paintings.title: Mona Lisa
paintings.description: The Mona Lisa is a half-length portrait painting by Italian artist Leonardo da Vinci. Considered an archetypal masterpiece of the Italian Renaissance, it has been described as the best known, the most visited, the most written about, the most sung about, the most parodied work of art in the world.

paintings.title: The Starry Night
paintings.description: The Starry Night is an oil-on-canvas painting by Dutch Post-Impressionist painter Vincent van Gogh. Painted in June 1889, it depicts the view from the east-facing window of his asylum room at Saint-Rémy-de-Provence, just before sunrise, with the addition of an imaginary village.

paintings.title: The Last Supper
paintings.description: The Last Supper is a mural painting by Italian High Renaissance artist Leonardo da Vinci. It depicts the scene of the Last Supper of Jesus with the Twelve Apostles, as it is told in the Gospel of John.
paintings.medium: Tempera on gesso, pitch, and mastic

paintings.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
paintings.description: Girl with a Pearl Earring is an oil painting by Dutch Golden Age painter Johannes Vermeer. It is a tronie of a girl wearing exotic dress and a large pearl earring. The work is oil on canvas and is 44.5 cm × 39 cm.

paintings.title: The Persistence of Memory
paintings.description: The Persistence of Memory is a 1931 painting by artist Salvador Dalí and one of the most recognizable works of Surrealism. The well-known surrealist piece introduced the image of the soft melting pocket watch.

paintings.title: The Creation of Adam
paintings.description: The Creation of Adam is a fresco painting by Italian artist Michelangelo, which forms part of the Sistine Chapel's ceiling, painted c. 1508–1512. It illustrates the Biblical creation narrative from the Book of Genesis in which God gives life to Adam, the first man.

paintings.title: The Night Watch
paintings.description: The Night Watch is a 1642 painting by Rembrandt van Rijn. It is in the collection of the Amsterdam Museum but is prominently displayed in the Rijksmuseum as the best known painting in its collection. The Night Watch is one of the most famous Dutch Golden Age paintings.

paintings.title: The Kiss
paintings.description: The Kiss is an oil-on-canvas painting with added gold leaf, silver and platinum by the Austrian Symbolist painter Gustav Klimt. It was painted at some point in 1907 and 1908, during the height of what scholars call his 'Golden Period'.
paintings.medium: Oil on canvas with gold leaf

paintings.title: The Birth of Venus
paintings.description: The Birth of Venus is a painting by the Italian artist Sandro Botticelli, probably executed in the mid 1480s. It depicts the goddess Venus arriving at the shore after her birth, when she had emerged from the sea fully-grown.

paintings.title: Guernica
paintings.description: Guernica is a large 1937 oil painting on canvas by Spanish artist Pablo Picasso. It is one of his best-known works, regarded by many art critics as the most moving and powerful anti-war painting in history.

paintings.title: The School of Athens
paintings.description: The School of Athens is a fresco by the Italian Renaissance artist Raphael. It represents philosophy and features many ancient Greek philosophers including Plato and Aristotle at the center. It is regarded as one of Raphael's masterpieces.

paintings.title: Primavera
paintings.description: Primavera is a large panel painting by Sandro Botticelli depicting a group of figures from classical mythology in a garden. It is one of the most written about and controversial paintings in the world.

paintings.title: The Arnolfini Portrait
paintings.description: The Arnolfini Portrait is an oil painting by Jan van Eyck. It is considered one of the most original and complex paintings in Western art history. The painting depicts the merchant Giovanni di Nicolao Arnolfini and his wife.

paintings.title: The Garden of Earthly Delights
paintings.description: The Garden of Earthly Delights is a triptych oil painting by Hieronymus Bosch. Housed in the Museo del Prado in Madrid, it has been the subject of numerous interpretations and is considered one of the most enigmatic works of art ever created.

paintings.title: David
paintings.description: David is a masterpiece of Renaissance sculpture created by Michelangelo. The 5.17-metre marble statue portrays the Biblical hero David at the moment he decides to battle Goliath. It is regarded as a masterpiece of Renaissance art and a symbol of strength.

paintings.title: The Sistine Madonna
paintings.description: The Sistine Madonna is an oil painting by Raphael. The painting has been highly praised and extensively copied, with the two putti at the bottom becoming one of the most recognizable images in Western art.

paintings.title: Las Meninas
paintings.description: Las Meninas is considered Velázquez's masterpiece and is one of the most analyzed works in Western art history. The painting shows a large room in the Madrid palace and several figures, including a self-portrait of the artist.

paintings.title: The Calling of Saint Matthew
paintings.description: The Calling of Saint Matthew is a masterpiece by Caravaggio depicting the moment when Jesus Christ inspires Matthew to follow him. The painting is noted for its dramatic use of light and shadow.

paintings.title: The Anatomy Lesson of Dr. Nicolaes Tulp
paintings.description: The Anatomy Lesson is an early masterpiece by Rembrandt depicting Dr. Nicolaes Tulp explaining the musculature of the arm to medical professionals. It established Rembrandt's reputation as a master painter.

paintings.title: The Art of Painting
paintings.description: The Art of Painting is one of Vermeer's most famous works. It depicts an artist painting a woman dressed as Clio, the muse of history. The painting showcases Vermeer's mastery of light and composition.

paintings.title: The Ecstasy of Saint Teresa
paintings.description: The Ecstasy of Saint Teresa is a sculptural group by Bernini in white marble set in an elevated aedicule. It depicts Teresa of Ávila's spiritual experience and is considered a masterpiece of the High Roman Baroque.

paintings.title: The Judgment of Paris
paintings.description: The Judgment of Paris is one of Rubens's most celebrated mythological paintings. It depicts the story from Greek mythology where Paris must choose the most beautiful goddess among Hera, Athena, and Aphrodite.

paintings.title: Judith Slaying Holofernes
paintings.description: Judith Slaying Holofernes is one of Artemisia Gentileschi's most famous works. The painting depicts the biblical story of Judith beheading the Assyrian general Holofernes with dramatic intensity and realism.

paintings.title: The Milkmaid
paintings.description: The Milkmaid is one of Vermeer's most famous paintings. It depicts a domestic kitchen maid pouring milk with remarkable realism and attention to light. The painting exemplifies the Dutch Golden Age genre painting.

paintings.title: The Swing
paintings.description: The Swing is one of the masterpieces of the Rococo era. The painting depicts a young woman on a swing being pushed by her husband while her lover watches from below. It exemplifies the playful and romantic themes of the Rococo period.

paintings.title: Pilgrimage to Cythera
paintings.description: Pilgrimage to Cythera is Watteau's most famous work and an icon of the Rococo movement. It depicts a dreamlike vision of lovers departing for the mythical island of Cythera, birthplace of Venus.

paintings.title: The Embarkation for Cythera
paintings.description: A variant of Watteau's masterpiece depicting aristocratic couples preparing to embark for the island of love. This painting established the genre of fêtes galantes.

paintings.title: The Toilet of Venus
paintings.description: The Toilet of Venus showcases Boucher's mastery of the Rococo style with its sensuous depiction of Venus at her toilette. The painting features the soft colors and playful eroticism characteristic of the period.

paintings.title: Madame de Pompadour
paintings.description: This portrait of Madame de Pompadour, Louis XV's mistress, is one of Boucher's most celebrated works. It captures the elegance and sophistication of the French Rococo court.

paintings.title: Gersaint's Shopsign
paintings.description: Gersaint's Shopsign was Watteau's last major work. It depicts the interior of an art dealer's shop with remarkable realism and serves as both a commercial sign and a masterpiece of Rococo art.

paintings.title: The Music Lesson
paintings.description: The Music Lesson exemplifies the Rococo fascination with intimate scenes of aristocratic leisure. Boucher's delicate brushwork and pastel colors create a scene of refined elegance.

paintings.title: Diana After the Hunt
paintings.description: Diana After the Hunt depicts the goddess Diana resting with her nymphs. The painting showcases Boucher's skill at mythological subjects and his characteristic soft, sensuous style.

paintings.title: The Shepherdess
paintings.description: The Shepherdess is a charming example of Fragonard's pastoral scenes. It depicts an idealized vision of rural life that was popular among the French aristocracy.

paintings.title: The Progress of Love: The Pursuit
paintings.description: Part of a series commissioned by Madame du Barry, The Pursuit depicts a young man pursuing his beloved in an idealized garden setting. The series represents the pinnacle of Rococo decorative painting.

paintings.title: The Oath of the Horatii
paintings.description: The Oath of the Horatii is a large painting that depicts a scene from Roman legend about a dispute between Rome and Alba Longa. It is considered a paragon of Neoclassical art with its emphasis on duty and self-sacrifice.

paintings.title: The Death of Marat
paintings.description: The Death of Marat depicts the murdered French revolutionary leader Jean-Paul Marat. It is one of the most famous images of the French Revolution and exemplifies David's neoclassical style.
paintings.museum: Royal Museums of Fine Arts of Belgium

paintings.title: Napoleon Crossing the Alps
paintings.description: This iconic portrait depicts Napoleon Bonaparte leading his army across the Alps. The painting is a masterpiece of propaganda art and one of the most reproduced images of Napoleon.

paintings.title: The Grande Odalisque
paintings.description: The Grande Odalisque depicts a concubine reclining in a harem. Despite criticism for its anatomical distortions, it has become one of Ingres's most famous works and an icon of Neoclassicism.

paintings.title: The Turkish Bath
paintings.description: The Turkish Bath is Ingres's final major work, depicting a group of nude women in a Turkish bath. The circular composition and sensuous forms make it one of the most striking examples of Orientalist painting.

paintings.title: The Intervention of the Sabine Women
paintings.description: This painting depicts the legendary intervention of the Sabine women to stop a battle between Romans and Sabines. It showcases David's mastery of composition and the classical nude figure.

paintings.title: La Source
paintings.description: La Source depicts a nude female figure pouring water from a vessel. The painting represents the ideal of classical beauty and is one of Ingres's most admired works.

paintings.title: The Apotheosis of Homer
paintings.description: The Apotheosis of Homer shows the Greek poet Homer being crowned by Victory. Surrounding him are famous figures from classical antiquity and later periods. The painting exemplifies Neoclassical ideals.

paintings.title: The Death of Socrates
paintings.description: The Death of Socrates depicts the philosopher Socrates moments before his execution by hemlock poisoning. The painting embodies Neoclassical virtues of stoicism and sacrifice for one's principles.

paintings.title: Psyche Revived by Cupid's Kiss
paintings.description: Psyche Revived by Cupid's Kiss is a sculpture depicting Cupid reviving Psyche with a kiss. It is considered Canova's masterpiece and one of the greatest examples of Neoclassical sculpture.

paintings.title: Liberty Leading the People
paintings.description: Liberty Leading the People commemorates the July Revolution of 1830 in France. The allegorical figure of Liberty leads the people forward over fallen bodies, holding the tricolour flag. It has become an enduring icon of freedom and democracy.

paintings.title: Wanderer above the Sea of Fog
paintings.description: Wanderer above the Sea of Fog depicts a lone man standing on a rocky precipice, gazing over a landscape covered in fog. It has become an iconic image of Romanticism, representing the sublime in nature.

paintings.title: The Raft of the Medusa
paintings.description: The Raft of the Medusa depicts the aftermath of the wreck of the French naval frigate Méduse. The painting's dramatic composition and emotional intensity made it an icon of the Romantic movement.

paintings.title: The Third of May 1808
paintings.description: The Third of May 1808 depicts the execution of Spanish rebels by French soldiers during the Peninsular War. The painting is renowned for its powerful anti-war message and dramatic use of light.

paintings.title: The Nightmare
paintings.description: The Nightmare depicts a woman in deep sleep with a demon crouched on her chest and a horse's head emerging from the shadows. It is one of the most iconic images of Romanticism, exploring themes of dreams and the supernatural.

paintings.title: The Death of Sardanapalus
paintings.description: The Death of Sardanapalus depicts the Assyrian king Sardanapalus watching his concubines and possessions destroyed as his enemies close in. The painting exemplifies Romantic exoticism and dramatic intensity.

paintings.title: The Hay Wain
paintings.description: The Hay Wain depicts a rural scene on the River Stour in Suffolk, England. Constable's naturalistic landscape painting had a profound influence on French Romantic painters and the development of landscape art.

paintings.title: The Fighting Temeraire
paintings.description: The Fighting Temeraire depicts the HMS Temeraire being towed to its final berth to be broken up. Turner's masterpiece symbolizes the end of an era and is celebrated for its sublime use of light and color.

paintings.title: The Slave Ship
paintings.description: The Slave Ship depicts the horrific practice of throwing sick slaves overboard during the Atlantic slave trade. Turner's dramatic use of color and light creates a powerful anti-slavery statement.

paintings.title: Saturn Devouring His Son
paintings.description: Saturn Devouring His Son is one of Goya's Black Paintings. It depicts the Greek myth of Titan Cronus eating one of his sons. The painting is renowned for its dark, disturbing imagery.

paintings.title: The Stone Breakers
paintings.description: The Stone Breakers depicts two laborers breaking stones for road construction. This painting was groundbreaking in its realistic portrayal of working-class life and became a manifesto of the Realist movement.

paintings.title: The Gleaners
paintings.description: The Gleaners depicts three peasant women gleaning a field of stray grain after the harvest. Millet's dignified portrayal of rural labor made this one of the most famous images of peasant life.

paintings.title: A Burial at Ornans
paintings.description: A Burial at Ornans depicts a funeral in Courbet's hometown. The monumental scale given to an ordinary provincial funeral was revolutionary and helped establish Realism as a major artistic movement.

paintings.title: The Angelus
paintings.description: The Angelus depicts two peasants praying in a field as the church bells ring for the evening Angelus. The painting became one of the most widely reproduced religious images of the 19th century.

paintings.title: The Horse Fair
paintings.description: The Horse Fair depicts the horse market in Paris with remarkable accuracy and dynamism. Bonheur's monumental painting established her as one of the most celebrated female artists of the 19th century.

paintings.title: The Third-Class Carriage
paintings.description: The Third-Class Carriage depicts ordinary passengers in a railway carriage. Daumier's sympathetic portrayal of working-class life exemplifies the social concerns of Realist art.

paintings.title: The Gross Clinic
paintings.description: The Gross Clinic depicts Dr. Samuel D. Gross operating in a surgical amphitheater. Eakins's unflinching realism and dramatic lighting make this one of the greatest American paintings of the 19th century.

paintings.title: The Thinker
paintings.description: The Thinker depicts a nude male figure in deep contemplation. Originally part of The Gates of Hell, it has become one of the most recognizable sculptures in the world and an icon of intellectual activity.

paintings.title: Barge Haulers on the Volga
paintings.description: Barge Haulers on the Volga depicts eleven laborers hauling a barge along the Volga River. Repin's powerful portrayal of human suffering and endurance became an icon of Russian Realist art.

paintings.title: The Artist's Studio
paintings.description: The Artist's Studio is a monumental allegorical work showing Courbet at his easel surrounded by figures representing different aspects of his life. It is considered one of the most important works of 19th-century art.

paintings.title: Impression, Sunrise
paintings.description: Impression, Sunrise depicts the port of Le Havre at sunrise. This painting gave the Impressionist movement its name and represents a radical departure from traditional painting techniques.

paintings.title: Water Lilies
paintings.description: Water Lilies is part of Monet's famous series depicting his garden at Giverny. The paintings showcase his mastery of light, color, and the reflection of nature on water.

paintings.title: Luncheon of the Boating Party
paintings.description: Luncheon of the Boating Party depicts a group of Renoir's friends relaxing on a balcony along the Seine. It is considered one of the finest examples of Impressionist figure painting.

paintings.title: Dance at Le Moulin de la Galette
paintings.description: Dance at Le Moulin de la Galette captures the vibrant atmosphere of a popular Parisian dance garden. Renoir's dappled sunlight and joyful crowd make it one of Impressionism's most celebrated works.

paintings.title: Boulevard Montmartre on a Winter Morning
paintings.description: Boulevard Montmartre on a Winter Morning is part of Pissarro's famous series of Paris boulevards. The painting captures the bustling energy of urban life with Impressionist technique.

paintings.title: The Ballet Class
paintings.description: The Ballet Class depicts young dancers rehearsing with their instructor. Degas's intimate portrayal of ballet dancers at work became one of his signature subjects.

paintings.title: Woman with a Parasol
paintings.description: Woman with a Parasol depicts Monet's wife Camille and their son on a windy summer day. The painting captures a fleeting moment with remarkable spontaneity and light.

paintings.title: The Absinthe Drinker
paintings.description: The Absinthe Drinker depicts a woman and man sitting in a Parisian café, capturing the isolation and alienation of modern urban life. It caused controversy when first exhibited.

paintings.title: Poplars
paintings.description: Poplars is part of Monet's series depicting poplar trees along the Epte River. The paintings explore variations in light and atmosphere across different seasons and times of day.

paintings.title: The Floor Scrapers
paintings.description: The Floor Scrapers depicts three workers scraping a parquet floor. Caillebotte's realistic treatment of working-class labor and dramatic perspective make it a unique work within Impressionism.

paintings.title: A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte
paintings.description: A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte is Seurat's masterpiece of Pointillism. The painting depicts Parisians relaxing in a suburban park using thousands of tiny dots of color.

paintings.title: Café Terrace at Night
paintings.description: Café Terrace at Night depicts a café in Arles, France. Van Gogh's vibrant colors and expressive brushwork create a luminous nighttime scene.

paintings.title: The Night Café
paintings.description: The Night Café depicts the interior of a café in Arles. Van Gogh used jarring colors to convey what he called 'the terrible passions of humanity.'

paintings.title: The Card Players
paintings.description: The Card Players is part of a series depicting Provençal peasants playing cards. Cézanne's structured compositions and bold use of form had a profound influence on modern art.

paintings.title: Mont Sainte-Victoire
paintings.description: Mont Sainte-Victoire is one of Cézanne's many paintings of the mountain near his home in Provence. His analytical approach to landscape painting influenced the development of Cubism.

paintings.title: Where Do We Come From? What Are We? Where Are We Going?
paintings.description: This large painting by Gauguin addresses fundamental existential questions. Painted in Tahiti, it synthesizes his Post-Impressionist style with Symbolist philosophy.

paintings.title: Vision After the Sermon
paintings.description: Vision After the Sermon depicts Breton women experiencing a vision of Jacob wrestling an angel. Gauguin's bold colors and flattened forms mark a departure from Impressionism.

paintings.title: At the Moulin Rouge
paintings.description: At the Moulin Rouge depicts the famous Parisian nightclub and its patrons. Toulouse-Lautrec's intimate portrayal of bohemian life captures the energy of Belle Époque Paris.

paintings.title: The Bedroom
paintings.description: The Bedroom depicts Van Gogh's room in Arles. The painting's simple subject and bold colors exemplify Van Gogh's unique vision and emotional approach to painting.

paintings.title: The Scream
paintings.description: The Scream is one of the most iconic images in art history. Munch's swirling composition and anguished figure express existential anxiety and emotional turmoil.
paintings.medium: Oil, tempera, pastel and crayon on cardboard

paintings.title: The Kiss
paintings.description: The Kiss depicts two lovers merged into a single form. Munch's expressionist treatment explores themes of passion, intimacy, and the dissolution of individual identity.

paintings.title: The Blue Rider
paintings.description: The Blue Rider depicts a cloaked figure on horseback in a landscape. The painting gave its name to Der Blaue Reiter, the influential Expressionist group founded by Kandinsky.

paintings.title: Street, Berlin
paintings.description: Street, Berlin depicts fashionable women on a Berlin street with angular, distorted forms. Kirchner's vivid colors and jarring composition capture the anxiety of modern urban life.

paintings.title: The Bride of the Wind
paintings.description: The Bride of the Wind depicts the artist and his lover Alma Mahler in a tumultuous embrace. The swirling, emotional composition exemplifies Austrian Expressionism.

paintings.title: Self-Portrait with Chinese Lantern Plant
paintings.description: This self-portrait by Schiele features his characteristic angular style and psychological intensity. The distorted forms and emotional rawness define Austrian Expressionism.

paintings.title: The Tower of Blue Horses
paintings.description: The Tower of Blue Horses depicts four blue horses in a pyramidal composition. Marc's use of symbolic color and spiritual approach to nature made him a key figure in German Expressionism.

paintings.title: The Large Blue Horses
paintings.description: The Large Blue Horses features three blue horses in a landscape. Marc believed animals possessed a spiritual purity, and his use of intense color expresses this vision.

paintings.title: Madonna
paintings.description: Madonna depicts a woman in a moment of ecstasy or spiritual transformation. Munch's sensual and spiritual treatment of the subject was controversial when first exhibited.

paintings.title: The Yellow Cow
paintings.description: The Yellow Cow depicts a leaping yellow cow in a joyful landscape. Marc's vibrant colors and dynamic composition express his belief in the spiritual essence of animals.

paintings.title: Les Demoiselles d'Avignon
paintings.description: Les Demoiselles d'Avignon is considered a seminal work in the development of Cubism and modern art. The painting's radical fragmentation of form broke with conventional perspective.

paintings.title: The Weeping Woman
paintings.description: The Weeping Woman depicts Dora Maar, Picasso's lover, in a state of anguish. The fragmented, angular forms express profound emotional pain through Cubist technique.

paintings.title: Three Musicians
paintings.description: Three Musicians depicts three figures in commedia dell'arte costumes playing instruments. The painting exemplifies Synthetic Cubism with its flat, decorative forms and bright colors.

paintings.title: Violin and Candlestick
paintings.description: Violin and Candlestick is a key work of Analytical Cubism. Braque fragments the objects into geometric planes, exploring multiple viewpoints simultaneously.
paintings.museum: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art

paintings.title: Houses at L'Estaque
paintings.description: Houses at L'Estaque is one of Braque's early Cubist landscapes. The geometric simplification of buildings and landscape marked a revolutionary approach to depicting space.

paintings.title: Girl with a Mandolin
paintings.description: Girl with a Mandolin is an important work of Analytical Cubism. The fragmented planes and muted colors create a complex geometric composition.

paintings.title: Portrait of Ambroise Vollard
paintings.description: Portrait of Ambroise Vollard depicts the famous art dealer in Analytical Cubist style. The fragmented face and overlapping planes demonstrate Picasso's revolutionary approach to portraiture.

paintings.title: Still Life with Chair Caning
paintings.description: Still Life with Chair Caning was the first collage in fine art. Picasso incorporated actual oilcloth printed with chair caning, pioneering the use of found materials in art.

paintings.title: The Portuguese
paintings.description: The Portuguese depicts a guitarist in a café. Braque's fragmented forms and incorporation of stenciled letters mark important developments in Analytical Cubism.

paintings.title: The Son of Man
paintings.description: The Son of Man depicts a man in a bowler hat with his face obscured by a floating green apple. This enigmatic image has become one of the most recognizable works of Surrealism.

paintings.title: The Treachery of Images
paintings.description: The Treachery of Images shows a pipe with the text 'This is not a pipe.' Magritte's philosophical painting questions the relationship between images, words, and reality.
paintings.museum: Los Angeles County Museum of Art

paintings.title: The Elephants
paintings.description: The Elephants depicts elephants with impossibly long, spindly legs carrying obelisks. Dalí's dreamlike imagery explores themes of strength and fragility.

paintings.title: The Burning Giraffe
paintings.description: The Burning Giraffe depicts a nightmarish scene with female figures supported by crutches and a burning giraffe in the background. It reflects Dalí's fears about the Spanish Civil War.

paintings.title: Swans Reflecting Elephants
paintings.description: Swans Reflecting Elephants uses Dalí's double image technique where swans and trees are reflected to create the image of elephants. It exemplifies his paranoiac-critical method.

paintings.title: The Harlequin's Carnival
paintings.description: The Harlequin's Carnival depicts a room filled with fantastical creatures and objects. Miró's playful, dreamlike composition is a masterpiece of Surrealist automatism.

paintings.title: The Great Masturbator
paintings.description: The Great Masturbator is a highly symbolic work exploring sexuality and psychological complexes. The distorted face and surreal imagery reflect Dalí's psychoanalytic interests.
paintings.museum: Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía

paintings.title: The Lovers
paintings.description: The Lovers depicts two people kissing with their heads covered by cloth. The painting explores themes of blindness, barriers to intimacy, and the unknowability of others.

paintings.title: Time Transfixed
paintings.description: Time Transfixed shows a locomotive emerging from a fireplace. Magritte's juxtaposition of ordinary objects in impossible situations challenges our perception of reality.

paintings.title: Composition VIII
paintings.description: Composition VIII is a masterpiece of geometric abstraction. Kandinsky's use of circles, lines, and triangles creates a dynamic visual symphony exploring pure form and color.

paintings.title: Broadway Boogie Woogie
paintings.description: Broadway Boogie Woogie was inspired by the grid of Manhattan and jazz music. Mondrian's final completed painting uses small colored rectangles to create rhythmic energy.

paintings.title: Composition with Red, Blue and Yellow
paintings.description: This iconic work exemplifies Mondrian's De Stijl aesthetic with its grid of black lines and primary color blocks. It represents the artist's search for universal harmony through pure abstraction.

paintings.title: Black Square
paintings.description: Black Square is a foundational work of abstract art and Suprematism. Malevich's radical reduction to a black square on white ground represents the rejection of representational art.

paintings.title: No. 5, 1948
paintings.description: No. 5, 1948 is one of Pollock's drip paintings created by pouring and dripping paint onto canvas. It exemplifies Abstract Expressionism and sold for a record price in 2006.

paintings.title: Autumn Rhythm
paintings.description: Autumn Rhythm is one of Pollock's most celebrated drip paintings. The rhythmic interplay of black, white, and brown paint creates a sense of motion and energy.

paintings.title: White on White
paintings.description: White on White depicts a white square floating on a white background. This radical work pushes Suprematist abstraction to its logical extreme.

paintings.title: Convergence
paintings.description: Convergence is one of Pollock's most colorful and complex drip paintings. The dense layers of paint create a dynamic field of energy and movement.

paintings.title: Woman I
paintings.description: Woman I is the first in de Kooning's famous Women series. The aggressive brushwork and distorted figure exemplify Abstract Expressionism's emotional intensity.

paintings.title: Orange, Red, Yellow
paintings.description: Orange, Red, Yellow features Rothko's signature color field technique with luminous rectangles of color. The painting sold for nearly $87 million in 2012.

paintings.title: The Dance
paintings.description: The Dance depicts five dancing figures in a circle. Matisse's bold colors and simplified forms make it one of the most important works of early modern art.

paintings.title: American Gothic
paintings.description: American Gothic depicts a farmer and his daughter in front of a house. It has become one of the most iconic images of American art and culture.

paintings.title: Christina's World
paintings.description: Christina's World depicts a woman lying in a field looking toward a distant house. The painting's haunting realism and emotional depth make it an American masterpiece.

paintings.title: Nighthawks
paintings.description: Nighthawks depicts people in a downtown diner late at night. Hopper's portrayal of urban isolation has become an enduring symbol of modern American life.

paintings.title: The Joy of Life
paintings.description: The Joy of Life is a large-scale painting depicting an Arcadian landscape with nude figures. Its bold colors and simplified forms were revolutionary in their departure from traditional representation.

paintings.title: Portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer I
paintings.description: This portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer is one of Klimt's most celebrated works. The extensive use of gold leaf and ornamental patterns exemplify his Golden Phase style.

paintings.title: Campbell's Soup Cans
paintings.description: Campbell's Soup Cans consists of 32 canvases, each depicting a different variety of Campbell's soup. The work launched Pop Art and challenged traditional notions of fine art.

paintings.title: Marilyn Diptych
paintings.description: Marilyn Diptych consists of fifty images of Marilyn Monroe, half in vibrant color and half in black and white. It explores themes of celebrity, mortality, and mass production.

paintings.title: The Lovers II
paintings.description: The Lovers II is a variant of Magritte's famous painting showing two people embracing with their heads covered. The work explores barriers to true intimacy and human connection.

paintings.title: Balloon Dog
paintings.description: Balloon Dog is a series of large stainless steel sculptures resembling balloon animals. One version sold for over $58 million, making it the most expensive work by a living artist at the time.
paintings.medium: Stainless steel with transparent color coating

paintings.title: Untitled (Portrait of Ross in L.A.)
paintings.description: This conceptual work consists of 175 pounds of candy, representing the artist's partner who died of AIDS. Visitors are encouraged to take pieces, symbolizing loss and love.
paintings.medium: Candies in multicolored cellophane, endless supply

paintings.title: My Bed
paintings.description: My Bed is an installation featuring the artist's unmade bed surrounded by detritus. It caused controversy when nominated for the Turner Prize and explores themes of personal trauma.

paintings.title: The Physical Impossibility of Death in the Mind of Someone Living
paintings.description: This controversial work features a preserved tiger shark in formaldehyde. It became an iconic symbol of the Young British Artists movement and explores mortality and fear.
paintings.medium: Tiger shark, glass, steel, formaldehyde solution

paintings.title: Untitled (Perfect Lovers)
paintings.description: Perfect Lovers consists of two identical battery-operated clocks set to the same time. As the batteries run down at different rates, the clocks fall out of sync, symbolizing mortality and loss.

paintings.title: Rhythm 0
paintings.description: Rhythm 0 was a performance where Abramović stood motionless for six hours while the audience could use 72 objects on her. It explored the limits of trust, vulnerability, and human behavior.

paintings.title: Puppy
paintings.description: Puppy is a massive topiary sculpture of a West Highland White Terrier covered in flowers. It stands 13 meters tall and has become an icon of contemporary public art.

paintings.title: For the Love of God
paintings.description: For the Love of God is a platinum cast of a human skull covered with 8,601 diamonds. It sold for £50 million, making it the most expensive contemporary artwork at the time.

paintings.title: Sleeping Muse
paintings.description: Sleeping Muse is an abstract bronze head that reduces the human form to its essential curves. Brâncuși's modernist sculpture influenced the development of abstract art.

paintings.title: The Gates
paintings.description: The Gates consisted of 7,503 saffron-colored fabric panels along paths in Central Park. This temporary installation attracted millions of visitors and transformed the park's landscape.

paintings.title: The Great Wave off Kanagawa
paintings.description: The Great Wave off Kanagawa is a woodblock print depicting an enormous wave threatening boats near Kanagawa. It is the most famous work of Japanese art and influenced European artists.

paintings.title: The Bayeux Tapestry
paintings.description: The Bayeux Tapestry is a Medieval embroidered cloth depicting the Norman conquest of England. It is nearly 70 meters long and provides invaluable historical documentation.

paintings.title: Hagia Sophia Mosaics
paintings.description: The Hagia Sophia mosaics are Byzantine masterpieces featuring Christ, the Virgin Mary, and various emperors. They represent the pinnacle of Byzantine religious art.

paintings.title: The Book of Kells
paintings.description: The Book of Kells is an illuminated manuscript Gospel book created by Celtic monks. Its intricate illustrations and calligraphy make it one of Ireland's greatest cultural treasures.

paintings.title: The Wilton Diptych
paintings.description: The Wilton Diptych is a portable altarpiece from Medieval England depicting King Richard II being presented to the Virgin and Child. Its exquisite detail exemplifies International Gothic style.

paintings.title: Terracotta Army
paintings.description: The Terracotta Army consists of thousands of life-sized clay soldiers buried with Emperor Qin Shi Huang. This archaeological wonder showcases the sophistication of ancient Chinese art.

paintings.title: Lascaux Cave Paintings
paintings.description: The Lascaux Cave Paintings are Paleolithic artworks depicting animals and human figures. They are among the finest examples of prehistoric art and date back approximately 17,000 years.

paintings.title: Nefertiti Bust
paintings.description: The Nefertiti Bust is a painted limestone sculpture of the Egyptian queen. It is one of the most copied works of ancient Egypt and an icon of feminine beauty.

paintings.title: The Standard of Ur
paintings.description: The Standard of Ur is a Sumerian artifact depicting war and peace scenes. This intricate mosaic box provides insight into one of the world's earliest civilizations.
paintings.medium: Wood inlaid with lapis lazuli, shell, and red limestone

paintings.title: The Mask of Tutankhamun
paintings.description: The Mask of Tutankhamun is a gold funerary mask of the Egyptian pharaoh. It is one of the most recognizable artifacts from ancient Egypt and a masterpiece of goldsmithing.
